Posts.Content: Aug 14, 2007 04:34AM mrsjck wrote: Great news, Helen, and especially after so long on various treatments. My story is similar...Arimidex, Faslodex, Taxol and now Xeloda...and my tumor markers are going way down too...but more importantly, my bone scan from 7/13 shows "no isotonic evidence of metastatic disease"...so WOOHOO...of course my oncologist is trying to find a scientific reason behind all this...me...I just accept it as a miracle...through the Xeloda...maybe...who cares...it is what it is...or should I say "what it isn't". I accept it with a grateful heart as I'm sure you do. My oncologist just this month switched me from 2wks on/1 off to 1 week on 1 week off...she went to another bc seminar in Boston and new info says that the first week on is the "irradicating" week and the second week is just toxins to us...so they are doing 1 on and 1 off. So far there are less tummy side effects and no hand/foot...but then I'm only on 2000 and have always been on that...for 7 cycles. Works for me...and I can't state emphatically enough that I am so happy for you!!!

Posts.Content: Aug 6, 2007 01:43AM mrsjck wrote: Hello "Metstobone2" and "Neva4" and welcome to our group of metsters. Although we are saddened by the addition of another sister we care enough to offer whatever support we can. I had 7-1/2 years of NED and then a backache prompted an MRI which led to bone mets to spine, hips, pelvis, femurs, skull. Started out on Arimidex and then Faslodex and then Taxol. Had a port put in and got blood clot and was put on Warfarin for that and then Xeloda and continuing Zometa. Am doing very well...no side effects and tumor markers are going down. My Xeloda dose is only 2000 mgs a day to minimize side effects but it is working nonetheless. This past bone scan, as compared to one in March, showed "no isostonic evidence of disease"....so I told my doctor I believe in miracles...she doesn't and feels it's a poor read on bone scan...even though it was done by 2 different radiologists!!! Anyway, I have my days of being tired...have given up motorcycle riding and camping...now we take 3-4 trips a year by plane...to a nice hotel...to swim and relax and sightsee....I suppose in some ways it has altered my quality of life...but, hey, this first class style suits me just fine...all I did was give up vacuuming, raking leaves, shoveling snow...can't beat that!!! Come here often and let it all out...we all understand even if we are not identical in symptoms or diagnosis...we are right up there with you in emotions and thoughts and fears....

Posts.Content: Mar 14, 2008 02:34PM mrsjck wrote: Hello, and first off let me offer my verbal support...it's a tough row to hoe and we all know that.  I have been battling this beast since 1998 initially...but the recurrence (s) hadn't occured until 2005 for a bone mets diagnosis and then 6 months ago with the liver.  The bone mets are pretty extensive but stable as well as the liver.  I have done A/C/T back in 1998; Arimidex and Faslodex and Taxol in 2005-6; Xeloda and Navelbine in 2007-8.  Seems like a lot of drugs...and it is...side effects have been tolerable...some more than others...the neuropathy from Taxol drives me nuts...but the rest is just run of the mill for having my system bombarded by drugs.  My tumor markers look to be increasing so now they are looking to change the chemo to something more aggressive...so I know the dread of which you speak...I'm hating the thought of anything else.  But I will continue the fight until it seems stupid to do so then it will be hospice.  But for now, I am gonna shake up those little beasties with all I can muster...and I hope you find the strength to do likewise.

Posts.Content: Sep 12, 2007 05:45AM mrsjck wrote: I was originally dx in 1998 with ER/PR+Her2- with one lymph involved...did the ACT and rads...stayed NED for 7 years.  10/05 tumor markers showed very high (CA27-29 @561 and CEA @1103).  Scans showed bone mets to spine, hips, pelvis, femurs, skull.  Did Arimidex for 8 mo. then Faslodex for 2; then Taxol for 2mo; then and now on Xeloda...tumor markers are down to below 100 on each...latest scan shows "no isotonic evidence of metastatic disease" so it seems to be working.  Tumor markers are fluctuating a little so they recently increased my Xeloda but I'm feeling fine...no pain and little side effects.  That makes 9 years with bc...not too shabby.
